data.title: Fellows Archive
data.text:
Professor Robert Frost

Professor Frost is interested in the history of Poland–Lithuania from the 15th to the 19th Century; the history of Scandinavia, in particular Sweden, in the early modern period; the history of political unions; and the history of early modern warfare. His current project is a history of the Polish–Lithuanian Union from 1385 to 1815 for…

Professor Bojie Fu

Professor Bojie Fu is Professor of Physical Geography and Landscape Ecology at the Research Centre for Eco-Environmental Sciences, Chinese Academy of Sciences. His research focuses on interactions between human beings and the environment and he has published more than 10 books, 400 scientific papers and over 170 papers in international journals. Bojie is a pioneer…

Professor Bob Furness

Bob Furness has over 35 years’ experience in academic ornithology. He has published over 300 scientific papers and supervised over 55 PhD students. In Google scholar his publications have been cited 30,000 times, with an h-index of 92. A recently published database of the world’s top 100,000 scientific researchers’ career research citation score with self-citations…

Professor Jonathan Fraser

Jonathan Fraser is a Professor of Mathematics and Statistics at the University of St Andrews, where he has worked since 2016. He was previously a Lecturer at the University of Manchester (2014-16) and a post-doc at the University of Warwick (2013-14). He gained his PhD in 2013 from the University of St Andrews. Jonathan is…

Professor Sonja Franke-Arnold

Sonja Franke-Arnold is a Professor for Quantum Optics at the University of Glasgow. She has over 25 years of research experience in complex light fields and atom cooling and trapping, and her research ranges from fundamental studies of light atom interaction and entanglement of spatial light modes to industry-led investigations of quantum-enhanced spectroscopy, high-resolution inertial…

Professor Peter France

Born Derry 19/10/35. Educated at Bradford Grammar School, Magdalen College Oxford, and France. Academic Posts at University of Sussex (1963-80) and University of Edinburgh (Professor of French, 1980-2000). Married to Siân Reynolds, 3 daughters.
